description: This file defines an 'EmptyState' component using Lightning.js. The component displays an ocean-themed prompt encouraging users to add their first note, including a button that triggers creation of a new note via store actions. It contains visual templates, focus management, and user interaction handlers.

classes.name: EmptyState
classes.description: A Lightning.js component that renders an ocean-themed UI prompting the user to add their first note, with focus management and a button to create notes.

methods.name: _template()
methods.description: Defines the visual structure and styling of the EmptyState component.

methods.name: _init
methods.description: Initializes the component, setting up actions from the store.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Setter for external callback invoked after a note is created.

methods.name: _handleEnter
methods.description: Handles the Enter key event, triggers note creation.

methods.name: _handleOk
methods.description: Alias for handleEnter, triggered on OK press.

methods.name: _getFocused
methods.description: Returns the currently focused element (the action button).

methods.name: _focus
methods.description: Handles focus styling when the component is focused.

methods.name: _unfocus
methods.description: Handles focus styling when the component loses focus.

methods.name: _handleEnterRelease
methods.description: Stub to prevent repeated triggers when holding the enter key.

methods.name: _createNote
methods.description: Asynchronous method to add a new note via store actions and invoke optional callback.

methods.name: mountTo
methods.description: Static method to instantiate and mount the component within a parent.

ctags.name: created
ctags.pattern: /^        const created = await add({ title: 'Untitled', content: '' });$/
